description: From Latin īnflātus, from the verb īnflō.

verbs.description: inflate (third-person singular simple present inflates, present participle inflating, simple past and past participle inflated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To enlarge an object by pushing air (or a gas) into it; to raise or expand abnormally
examples: You inflate a balloon by blowing air into it.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To enlarge by filling with air (or a gas).
examples: The balloon will inflate if you blow into it.
to inflate somebody with pride or vanity

entries.meaning: (transitive, computing) To decompress (data) that was previously deflated.
